Preparing for Creative Industries: (A) Real World Encounters

In this module students will devise an integrated Communications strategy to realise a selfinitiated brief and tailor their learning to their own areas of interest such as Advertising, Marketing or Public Relations. This approach serves to enrich communication skills while focusing on specific interests, fostering an environment of personal and professional growth. The syllabus aims and learning outcomes of this module A prepare the student with a foundation and skillset on which to build and progress into the module B in year 3 semester 2.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Formulate a comprehensive design brief, demonstrating an understanding of key components required for a design project.

+  Use strategic capabilities by integrating a custom strategy to realising a design brief.

+  Display critical thinking and professional communication skills through a visual report and pitch presentation.

+  Evidence autonomous learning and professional growth through own reflection.
